sentences.english: Passersby, one by one, threw paper money and coins into the small bucket beside his feet.
sentences.chinese: 过路人纷纷向他脚下的一个小铁桶里扔着纸币和硬币。

sentences.english: A slight, metallic sound, as of coins rattling in a pocket.
sentences.chinese: 叮铛声一种象口袋中硬币碰撞发出轻微。

sentences.english: The zinc nail and the copper penny are called electrodes.
sentences.chinese: 镀锌钉和铜硬币就是电池的电极。

sentences.english: Let's flip a coin to decide who should go first - do you want heads or tails?
sentences.chinese: 我们来抛硬币决定谁先走吧，你是要正面还是要反面？

sentences.english: Gather as much money as you can by clicking on the coins.
sentences.chinese: 尽可能多地点击硬币来捡钱。

sentences.english: He fished a coin out of a drawer and began scratching off the latex coating.
sentences.chinese: 他从抽屉里拿出一个硬币，开始刮开橡胶涂层。

sentences.english: Blindy felt it before he put it in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 盲汉摸了摸硬币，然后放进口袋。

sentences.english: Pick up the receive and drop a coin into the slot.
sentences.chinese: 拿起电话筒，然后投一枚硬币到投币孔里去。

sentences.english: Here's two hundreds and a ten-dollar coin.
sentences.chinese: 我给你二张一百元和一枚十元硬币。

sentences.english: This is the other side of the coin.
Airline personnel collect the spare coins and paper currency from passengers.
sentences.chinese: 航空公司工作人员从乘客那里收集这些硬币和纸币。

sentences.english: He steadied a coin on the top of the basketball bank.
sentences.chinese: 他把一枚硬币稳稳地放在篮板的顶上面。

sentences.english: I have one cent, he said. It is an American coin.
sentences.chinese: 他心想，我有一分钱呢，一枚美元硬币。

sentences.english: I can give you quarters, if that'll help.
sentences.chinese: 如果二角五分的硬币管用的话，我可以给你换一些。

sentences.english: Pennies in particular are rarely pure copper.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，硬币很少使用纯铜制造的。

sentences.english: Paradox and discovery are two sides of the same coin.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾和发现是同一枚硬币的两面。

definition: fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)
paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
